context: It's this game (Japanese) playable in US Console?
response: Yes I play it on my American profile of ps3 but if you want to claim your dlc you have to have a japanese psn account if you got other questions you can message me on ps3 (Rosak00)

context: This can connect to the PC as well to charge right?
response: Yep but you can't play with the play & charge kit on the Pc it is just for Xbox

context: How long is the length of the cord i need one that is at least 6ft

response: i read it works for 8 but i would read up on it before buying it...that was my mistake i didnt read on it before i bought it

context: Does this mouse still work the same for left handed people?
response: No the forward and back buttons as well as the additional 2 buttons are set up for the thumb of your right hand. Now if you chose NOT to use those 4 buttons then yes it should be fine... But then what would be the point of ordering a multi-button mouse?

context: What machine does this play on?
response: The figures play on all the platforms. Ps3  Xbox. Wii

context: Can I use this game on a Japanese PS3?
response: Yes you should, unless the Disc Type is not compatible in Japan or on Japanese (as u say) PS3 devices. Mine is BLUS30902GH

I havent tried it, but I checked the steelseries site, and the driver states win 7 as the latest.  I believe it works on 8.0 though.  There is a wireless one that has updated kernel drivers, but it  is very expensive.

context: I have win 7 and an early version of Civ 4 (the "Game of the Year" edition).  I cannot install it on Windows 7.  Will this version work with win 7?
response: I have Windows 7 64 bit and it installed fine and works fine.

context: Do these have any play to them? I've looked at several different reveiws and can't figure out if they actually have a deadzone or not.
response: I got three pair and none of mine had play they r very precises, very good fit

context: Would this work with any headphones like beats or apple headphones?
response: Yes, I have Beats headphones and it works fine for both game sound and chat.

context: I am replacing a generic white wireless Gamecube controller.  Will it's receiver work with a Wavebird?
response: No, the official Nintendo wave bird receiver is necessary. Other 3rd party receivers won't operate on the same fequencies

context: What machine does this play on?
response: The characters/figures like this Elsa one work on all bases regardless of platform/gaming system.  I believe the bases may also be interchangeable since they all use the standard USB interface.  Also, the Wii U version of the game is now available and free.

context: i am havin windows 8.1 will it work
response: Yes it will work as it is not the system that will cause it not to work it is the game/program that you might have problems' with.

context: Does this come with the leather carrying case? (I used to own a pair of these and the case was very nice.)
response: I don't think it was leather - more of a small, soft, draw-string bag.

context: Can it be played off line?
Does the grip have a toggle to turn on and off the ability to charge so that the grip isn't always charging the vita?
response: No it does not! But I do 2 things to prevent pver charging.  1) I set the vita in grip and dont plug the grip into the charge port.  2) I just drain the grip battery to where there is no charge and us the grip just as a grip.
